intro: Ochna ciliata var. hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's ochna, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in woodland and scrub habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
